channel.title: SVG Problem
channel.description:
For some inexplicable reason, when I host a .svg file on my website, Firefox doesn't display it, but it gives me the option to download it. It displays one I found on w3schools perfectly, and Opera displays both fine.
[url=http://sneamia.net/test.php5]This is the test website[/url].
Does it have something to do with how my server handles svg files?

item.title: SVG Problem
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:132503”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=183447.msg1667681#msg1667681 date=1186883911]
Both of the blue squares display fine for me. So the problem might be with your computer? although you said w3 displays :\ and I’m sure you’ve tried closing and re-opening FF.
[/quote]

Yea I just fixed it. The problem was that my server didn’t have the proper MIME type for SVG. I just stuck this in an .htaccess in that directory and it worked.

AddType image/svg+xml svg
AddType image/svg+xml svgz

Thanks though. :D[/quote]
Yep lol, glad you got it workin.

Read full topic

item.title: SVG Problem
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

therealjdb:

Both of the blue squares display fine for me. So the problem might be with your computer? although you said w3 displays :\ and I’m sure you’ve tried closing and re-opening FF.

Yea I just fixed it. The problem was that my server didn’t have the proper MIME type for SVG. I just stuck this in an .htaccess in that directory and it worked.

AddType image/svg+xml svg
AddType image/svg+xml svgz

Thanks though.
